title: Texas National Guard - Student protests, April 24, 2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications to or from the Governor or the Office of the Governor concerning the events at the University of Texas, Austin on April 24, 2024 and/or April 25, 2024.

2. Any communications to or from the Governor or the Office of the Governor concerning demonstrations, protests, or events at any public university or college. This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2024.

3. Any communications to or from the Texas Military Department Public Affairs (including any person employed by the Texas Military Department Public Affairs) concerning the April 24, 2024 and/or April 25, 2024 demonstrations at Texas universities, including UT Austin and UT San Antonio.

4. Any statements provided to media by the Texas Military Department Public Affairs or its officials concerning the demonstrations on April 24, 2024 or April 25, 2024, and any draft versions of those statements.

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent student housing software RFP, signed contract and vendor proposal, I believe this should be under EZREZLife or Adirondack.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Justin Wenig

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any recordings (including video and audio captured by body cameras, vehicle-mounted devices, or handheld devices) concerning interactions with demonstrators at or near Emerson College on April 24 and/or 25, 2024.

2. Any incident reports or after-incident reports resulting from the demonstrations at or near Emerson College on April 24 and/or 25, 2024.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
